snippet: A woman whose mother, brother and partner all died, began drinking to assuage her grief. It led to crime, arrests and finally sobriety.
abstract: Community Service Society uses funds from The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund   to pay Edwuana  Raven Eley's fee for carpenters' union, into which she has been reinstated after period of drinking, crime, arrests and finally sobriety.
lead_paragraph: A woman whose mother, brother and partner all died, began drinking to assuage her grief. It led to crime, arrests and finally sobriety.

headline.seo: From Grief to Drinking to Crime, Then Sobriety
headline.main: Finding Sobriety After Grief and Crime
headline.print_headline: Finding Sobriety After Grief and Crime

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
